alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 19 at 1:01AM EST until January 19 at 6:15AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 615 AM EST. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 10 TO THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Sudbury River at Saxonville. * WHEN...From Wednesday, January 10 to this morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding will affect low lying areas along the river in Wayland, including a portion of Shore Road and Pelham Island Road near Heards Pond. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 AM EST Friday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 9.4 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
